column2: MISSOURI DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: MO

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Alcohol:
column4: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column6: increases reaction time.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 2. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column6: Get enough sleep.
column8: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column2: 3. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column10: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 4. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 5. Which shape is a warning sign?
column6: Round
column8: Triangle

column2: 6. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
7. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column6: try to pass close behind.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 8. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Pull the steering wheel back.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column8: Emergency stop ahead
column10: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 10. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column6: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column10: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 11. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column6: A shared lane
column8: A slow-moving vehicle

column2: 13. Emergency vehicles:
column6: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column8: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.

column2: 14. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Near school zones.
column10: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a cross road.
column8: a sharp turn.

column2: 16. A flashing red light means:
column6: Slow down before entering.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 17. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: signal.

column2: 18. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column6: School zone
column8: Stop

column2: 19. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column6: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.
column8: yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.

column2: 20. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column6: slow down or move over safely.
column8: avoid making eye contact.

column2: 21. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column8: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 22. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 23. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column6: only when other vehicles yield.
column8: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 24. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column6: white
column8: orange

column2: 25. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column6: Take a cold shower before driving.
column8: Drink coffee before driving.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
